result.execSummary:
The defendant Lori A Wittchow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: -Restitution of $1,116.49 is to be paid to the probation office.  Court costs are to be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

-To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Motion and Order for Withdrawal

3:35 p.m.  Defendant and present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 in 2017CM57 and court 1 in 2015CM122 with probation.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 in 2017CM57 and count 1 in 2015CM122.  Court orders counts 2 thru 6 in 2015CM122 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Wilsnack.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2017CM57 / 2015CM122 (count 1) - EACH

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

-Restitution - $1,116.49. To be paid to the probation office.
-Court costs.  To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-AODA and any follow-up 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

Court adjourned at 3:44 p.m.
